description: The course emphasizes a systems engineering approach to project management including the cycle costing and analysis, project scheduling, project organization and control, contract management, project monitoring and negotiations. In addition, the coure will also examine management issues in large infrastructure projects like non-recourse or limited recourse project financing. Examples from the logistics planning process and global software project management will be used to highlight the course topics.
name: PROJECT MANAGEMENT

values.comments:
The course emphasizes a systems engineering approach to project management
including the cycle costing and analysis, project scheduling, project organization and
control, contract management, project monitoring and negotiations. In addition, the
course also examines management issues in large infrastructure projects like nonrecourse
or limited recourse project financing. Examples from the logistics planning
process and global software project management are used to highlight the course topics.
Overall, students criticized this class, describing it as “poorly organized” and
“boring.” Many felt that there was too much busywork and that the assignment
instructions were extremely vague. They spent time writing reports for a fictional project,
but commented that executing an actual project would have been more useful.
Students felt that Professor Pourdehnad should have given more directions on the
assignments. They also felt that the exams were confusing and that the questions should
be worded more clearly.
Students found this to be a relatively easy class. However, opinion regarding the
workload was mixed. While some thought that there was too much work, others felt that
there was only busywork involved.
